messages.content: Have you ever struggled to get clarity on a policy?
Yes, during COVID, there was a lot of confusion about work-from-home allowances. HR gave conflicting answers and that created unnecessary tension.
What could we have done to make you stay?
A clearer growth path and more structured career conversations could have made a big difference. Also, more openness to internal transfers.
What could your manager improve on?
Empathy and availability. Sometimes we feel like we’re being treated as resources, not people, especially during high-stress cycles.
Is there anything you would change about your day-to-day work experience?
I’d love to have fewer ad-hoc meetings and more time for deep work. Also, a bit more clarity on priority tasks would help streamline my week.
Do you believe gender or identity bias exists in the workplace?
Not openly, but in subtle ways, yes. For instance, women are sometimes interrupted more during meetings, and fewer of them are in visible leadership roles.
Did you get feedback you can act on?
A little. It was mostly generic, “good job,” “keep it up” - but nothing concrete to work on.
How would you describe your team dynamics?

Our team dynamics are generally healthy. We communicate openly, and everyone pulls their weight. Sometimes, however, deadlines bring stress and people get short-tempered, but we usually resolve things quickly.
Have you been offered growth opportunities?
A few, yes, mainly stretch projects. But I’d like a more defined mentorship or leadership pathway.
Do you feel supported in your role by your manager?
Yes, my manager has my back when it counts. They’re willing to step in when things escalate and always try to unblock me.
How was your onboarding experience?
Decent, but slightly chaotic. Too much paperwork and not enough introduction to actual workflows.
What did you enjoy the most during your time here?
The people. I’ve built friendships and learned so much from my peers. Also, the sense of purpose in some projects was deeply fulfilling.
Any final advice for the organization?
Listen more deeply to employee feedback and don’t wait until someone resigns to ask how they’re doing.
